page.title: 18EDUCATION IN HONING AREA
page.content: For educational administrative purposes Norfolk is divided into 5 areas,and the boundary between two of these,the north and east,runs through this block. In response to falling rolls generally, schools are being amalgamated. Honing school closes in 1985 and the 12 remaining pupils will transfer to local schools. Their dispersal is complicated in that the northern area maintains primary schools for the 5-11 age range,the east first and middle schools for 5-8 and 8-12yrs. Honing parish is being ceded to the east,and from Sept.85 children aged to 8 will be educated at E.Ruston first school,then at Stalham Middle and High schools. The remaining 8 pupils could opt for their schooling to continue in the northern area-3 to Nth.Walsham New High school,and 3 to Manor Rd. Junior School, Nth. Walsham.
